means: [常作复数]（人生事件中的）时运
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 福琼绰号，赌徒，来源于中世纪英语、古法语，含义是“运气”(chance,luck)
[人名] [苏格兰人姓氏] 福琼住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“猪+圈用地，居留地”(hog,pig+enclosure,settlement)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"命运，运气"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: destiny, fate, lot, doom, luck, fortune
means: destiny ： 普通用词，侧重预先注定的命运，对未来命运的美好憧憬。
fate ： 较庄严用词，多指不幸的命运，暗示不可避免，令人畏惧和人的意志无法改变，宿命论色彩较浓。
lot ： 多指偶然的运气或终身遭受的不幸命运。
doom ： 指最终的，常常是灾难性或毁灭性的命运，隐含不可避免的意味。
luck ： 普通日常用词，指好的或坏的运气，尤多指好运气，有时也指成功或愉快的结局。
fortune ： 普通用词，指由机会或运气来决定的一种命运，如暗示一种比fate好的运气或一种愉快的未来。

sentence.Network_en: She built up her fortune by cannily playing the stock market.
Jane is determined to hold on to her fortune.
sentence.Network_cn: 简决心要守住自己的财产。

sentence.Network_en: When fortune smiled on him, he made the most of it.
sentence.Network_cn: 当好运来临时，他充分把握住了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)a successful person is often one who is willing to take risks
the unpredictable, haphazard events of war
acquire great wealth by one's own efforts
make predictions about a person's future by palmistry, using a crystal ball, or similar divining methods

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin Fortuna, the name of a goddess personifying luck or chance

entry.def: You can refer to a large sum of money as a fortune or a small fortune to emphasize how large it is.

example.ex: We had to eat out all the time. It ended up costing a fortune...
example.tran: 我们不得不总在外面吃饭，结果花了很多钱。

example.ex: He made a small fortune in the London property boom.
example.tran: 他在伦敦房产升温的时候发了一笔小财。

entry.def: Someone who has a fortune has a very large amount of money.

example.ex: He made his fortune in car sales...
Having spent his rich wife's fortune, the Major ended up in a debtors' prison.
example.tran: 花光了他有钱老婆的财产之后，这位少校最后被关进了债务人监狱。

entry.def: Fortune or good fortune is good luck. Ill fortune is bad luck.

example.ex: Government ministers are starting to wonder how long their good fortune can last.
example.tran: 政府部长们开始怀疑他们的好运还能够持续多久。

entry.def: If you talk about someone's fortunes or the fortunes of something, you are talking about the extent to which they are doing well or being successful.

example.ex: The electoral fortunes of the Liberal Democratic party may decline...
example.tran: 自由民主党的选举运势可能会下降。

example.ex: She kept up with the fortunes of the Reeves family...
example.tran: 她一直关注着里夫斯家族的兴衰。

entry.def: If you talk about the way someone or something is treated by fortune, you are referring to the good or bad luck that they have.

example.ex: He is certainly being smiled on by fortune.
example.tran: 现在他一定是得到了命运的垂青。

entry.def: When someone tells your fortune, they tell you what they think will happen to you in the future, which they say is shown, for example, by the lines on your hand.

means.word_mean: 1. an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that causes an event to result one way rather than another;

sentences.sentence: "we ran into each other by pure chance"

means.word_mean: 2. a large amount of wealth or prosperity
3. an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that leads to a favorable outcome;

sentences.sentence: "it was my good luck to be there"
"it was as if fortune guided his hand"

means.word_mean: 4. your overall circumstances or condition in life (including everything that happens to you);

auth_sentence.content: But these companies make a fortune, he says.
auth_sentence.res_content: But these companies make a fortune, he says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But these companies make a fortune, he says.

auth_sentence.content: Sounds like a fortune by most people's standards.

Sentence.sentence: She inherited a big fortune from her father.
She made a big fortune from wise investment

means.word_mean: 机会, 运气, 转机

sentences.en: By a stroke of fortune, he won the competition.
sentences.cn: 他靠运气在竞赛中获胜了。

sentences.en: That old Gipsy woman tells fortunes.
sentences.cn: 那个吉卜赛老妇人替人算命。
命运之神向我们露出了笑脸。

means.word_mean: 庞大的财富, 财产, 大笔的钱, 巨款

sentences.en: He came into a large fortune when his rich uncle died.
sentences.cn: 有钱的叔父死后, 他继承了一大笔财产。

jushi.english: He did not deserve such fortune.
He has run through his whole fortune.
jushi.chinese: 他把全部家产挥霍一空。

jushi.english: I had my fortune told last week.
